_header: My hearts joy all mine whole pleasaunce
Note: For a version in rhyme royal see 3509.
_description: To my Heart’s Joy — three 8-line stanzas and 4-line Envoy

Lam306.First Lines:
My hertes Ioie all my whole pleasaunceWhiche that y sarue and
                    schall do faithfully…
Lam306.Last Lines:
…As wyssely god me saveAs y am onely yoursWhat payne so
                    euer I haueAnd will be at all owres
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 40; rev. ed. 68.
